intro: Disperis bifida, commonly known as the narrow-leafed disperis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pale green or white, often clustered in loose inflorescences. Disperis bifida thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in grasslands or along stream banks. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
